creator: houston@arsc.edu
text:
Apache 2.0.44 with mod_dav and mod_dav_fs running on SGI Irix 6.5.17 accessed
though stunnel and mod_ssl using openssl 0.9.6i from a Mac OS X 10.2.3 platform
using Dreamweaver MX 6.1 DAV interface.

Using Dreamweaver with the DAV mount point I make a file duplicate, which works.
The new file is now named "Copy of filename.html" and can be manipulated in any
way, including deleted through DAV. But an attempt to rename the file, say to
filename2.html using DAV yields the following:

2003Feb28 13:20:20 1.2.3.4 houston 502 414 MOVE /Copy%20of%20favicon.ico
HTTP/1.1 Dreamweaver-WebDAV-SCM1.02 -

No error log entry is created, nor is there a core file generated. Reading the
source has not led me to an answer...yet.

I compiled apache using the SGI C compiler 7.x (not sure, I think x=3)

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
Does the client (Dreamweaver) have a way to display the error message returned
by Apache/mod_dav?  It looks to me like the response body sent by Apache should
have some information in it describing the reason for the error.

(wondering to self: how can we get mod_ext_filter in the filter chain for the
error path and use it to run the response body through tee to save the response
body in a file as well as ship it down to the client?)

creator: houston@arsc.edu
text:
I spent much time trying to get Dreamweaver to devulge its DAV log without
success. If I knew the headers necessary to request a MOVE using telnet I would
do so, as I can then capture the response exactly. Anyone have a capture of a
session that I can adapt to request a MOVE by hand?

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
This works for me for collecting a trace of an error document.  I haven't
tested it with DAV though.

You need mod_ext_filter loaded.  Make sure the path to tee is correct.  Replace
"/tmp/lowleveltrace" with the file where you want the trace to be stored.
In this example, the respone for anything under /broken will be traced.

ExtFilterDefine lowleveltrace \
cmd="/usr/bin/tee /tmp/lowleveltrace" ftype=31

<Location /broken>
SetOutputFilter lowleveltrace
</Location>

So, I finally found out how to issue a MOVE by hand and see this in the return
response. I immediately determine this has to do with how I have DAV setup, and
is not a DAV bug...a feature maybe, but not a bug. I am using stunnel to get DAV
over SSL. Everything works, and I mean everything, except MOVE, because move
requires that the Destination: header be an URI. In my case that URI is
http://localhost:8888/somefile.name, not the hostname DAV wants.

HTTP/1.1 502 Bad Gateway

I am closing this bug in frustration. I guess I will correct this on the server
with mod_rewrite.
creator: houston@arsc.edu
